paper.title: A new portfolio selection problem in bubble condition under uncertainty: Application of Z-number theory and fuzzy neural network
paper.abstract: In this paper, a new mathematical formulation for a portfolio selection problem is developed. This model is based on the difference between fundamental value and market value of assets. The proposed model is especially applicable in bubble conditions. Input data of the developed model are subjected to uncertainty. To consider data uncertainty, the Z-number theory is employed. Additionally, a fuzzy neural network is used to predict market value of assets in different economic conditions as input data of the developed model. To show advantages of the proposed model, its results are compared to the mean absolute deviation (MAD), Conditional Value at Risk (CVaR), and Value at Risk (VaR). Results show that the deterministic formulation of proposed model performs better than MAD, CVaR, and VaR in bubble condition. Moreover, fuzzy formulations of all mentioned models perform better than their deterministic formulations in terms of capturing risk of a bubble. Finally, results illustrate that application of the Z-number theory in the proposed model makes the new portfolio selection problem reliable in bubble condition with respect to calculating risk of bubble bursting and proposing the best portfolio among all deterministic and nondeterministic formulations in bubble conditions.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心内容是开发一种新的投资组合选择模型，特别适用于泡沫条件下的资产配置。论文讨论了如何利用Z-number理论和模糊神经网络来处理不确定性，并比较了不同模型在泡沫条件下的表现。这些内容明确指向投资组合管理领域，而非衍生品定价或金融风险管理。
